Articles.Content:
Here are a few parts I sweep off the run way today, I saw the post on mini planes.

My 1st try and it flys well.

Used Avionics pack and then tried the nose cone and missles, flies but not stable till missiles are released.

I had a few screws and parts from the runway and made this Mini bi-jet plane Peanut Spy Fly .

<table style="width:auto;"><tr><td><a href="https://picasaweb.google.com/lh/photo/txJps4oDVaMaYIhG5_4uddMTjNZETYmyPJy0liipFm0?feat=embedwebsite"><img src="https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-QoF-AfVM1qw/UFkuW7xCxSI/AAAAAAAAAE4/XGPBuVqd-pg/s144/PeanutsSF.JPG" height="144" width="140" /></a></td></tr><tr><td style="font-family:arial,sans-serif; font-size:11px; text-align:right">From <a href="https://picasaweb.google.com/107098216359889121027/September182012?authuser=0&feat=embedwebsite">September 18, 2012</a></td></tr></table>

<table style="width:auto;"><tr><td><a href="https://picasaweb.google.com/lh/photo/J5Q14oyAzjVuPGdOQIENT9MTjNZETYmyPJy0liipFm0?feat=embedwebsite"><img src="https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-pPuoWmW7zCA/UFkuVsrorRI/AAAAAAAAAEw/b9i0wxS93KU/s144/PeanutsSF1.JPG" height="108" width="144" /></a></td></tr><tr><td style="font-family:arial,sans-serif; font-size:11px; text-align:right">From <a href="https://picasaweb.google.com/107098216359889121027/September182012?authuser=0&feat=embedwebsite">September 18, 2012</a></td></tr></table><table style="width:auto;"><tr><td><a href="https://picasaweb.google.com/lh/photo/El9x4-1Kywfu35m_U3RV2dMTjNZETYmyPJy0liipFm0?feat=embedwebsite"><img src="https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-QLWtNg_4Lnc/UFkz-FwTcoI/AAAAAAAAAFY/wsFzG5hyDNA/s144/PeanutsSF2.JPG" height="108" width="144" /></a></td></tr><tr><td style="font-family:arial,sans-serif; font-size:11px; text-align:right">From <a href="https://picasaweb.google.com/107098216359889121027/September182012?authuser=0&feat=embedwebsite">September 18, 2012</a></td></tr></table>

There are some real masters at modeling supplying us with some very cool parts. I thank them all.

We hope to build some wacky stuff and maybe one that will get the NetSat in orbit and on to the mun, That's a big maybe, we deal in used parts so we'll see. As the ship in the garage get a bit more custom I'll post file links.

Here is my latest build of scrape parts.

I call it Mosquito in honor of the DE HAVILLAND D.H.98 that I read about in the latest copy of AIR & SPACE Smithsonian magazine.

I used a tail design from the P-38 and upgraded engine to jet power. It fly's well under manual control.

[ATTACH=CONFIG]34504[/ATTACH][ATTACH=CONFIG]34505[/ATTACH][ATTACH=CONFIG]34506[/ATTACH][ATTACH=CONFIG]34507[/ATTACH]
